item.title: Vim Navigation and Useful Commands Cheatsheet
item.description:
üìù Introduction

This post is primarily for my own use, containing Vim commands that I frequently use or am trying to learn and remember. It focuses on essential motions and navigation techniques to improve efficiency.

Note: This post changes and updates frequently.

üè† Basics

Basic commands to get started with Vim.

  • i ‚Üí Insert mode
  • ESC ‚Üí Exit insert mode
  • :w ‚Üí Save file
  • :q ‚Üí Quit
  • :wq or ZZ ‚Üí Save and quit
  • :q! ‚Üí Quit without saving

üîÑ Moving Around

Essential motions for navigating within a file efficiently.

item.title: Why Nix and nix-darwin Are Great for macOS
item.description: Learn why Nix and nix-darwin are powerful tools for macOS development and how I use them to streamline my workflow.

item.title: Estimating Photometric Redshifts of Galaxies and QSOs with Machine Learning
item.description: A comprehensive look at leveraging machine learning techniques to estimate photometric redshifts using Sloan Digital Sky Survey (SDSS) data. This post explores methodologies, results, and implications for modern cosmology.

item.title: Quantum Decoherence of Central Spin Systems
item.description: A detailed exploration of quantum decoherence in central spin systems using the Chebyshev expansion method, validated against Qutip simulations.
